ai.summary: The Canterbury Outer Ring Walk is a challenging 61.2 km circular hike around Canterbury, in Kent, England, United Kingdom. The route traverses rural farmland, hedged lanes and woodlands, offering scenic countryside and multiple gate crossings. Expect a long day of walking with varied terrain and several gentle elevation changes.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily rural countryside with well-marked hedgerow footpaths, farm tracks and quiet lanes. surfaces vary from compacted paths and gravel to muddy fields, with occasional road crossings, gates or stiles and some gentle hills.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long days' hike; carry a map and compass or a reliable GPS, and stay on marked paths. Check weather and daylight hours; bring adequate water and snacks. Be mindful of livestock on farmland, road sections, and uneven ground. Inform someone of your route and expected finish time. Have a basic first aid kit and emergency contact details, and bring a charged phone as a backup.
recommended_gear: Ordnance Survey map and compass or GPS backup
Head torch or flashlight with extra batteries
Personal identification and emergency contact info
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) are ideal; the route is feasible year-round with proper gear and shorter daylight hours.

seo.title: Canterbury Outer Ring Walk – 61.2 km Circular Hike Around Canterbury, UK
seo.meta_description: Explore the Canterbury Outer Ring Walk, a challenging 61.2 km circuit around Canterbury in Kent, England. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear recommendations for hikers.
